new_generated_rule_explanation: The rule 'JUnit5ObsoleteAssertions' checks all classes and their methods. If a method contains calls to 'junit.framework.Assert', 'org.junit.Assert', or 'org.junit.Assume', it asserts that the method does not contain calls to 'org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions' and 'org.junit.jupiter.api.Assumptions'. If the assertion fails, it generates a message suggesting migration to 'org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions' or 'org.junit.jupiter.api.Assumptions'.
